IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO INSTILL IN STUDENTS THE SCHOLARSHIP, DISCIPLINE AND HONOR NECESSARY TO SUCCEED IN COLLEGE AND BEYOND.
IRS990.MissionDesc: NOBLE'S MISSION IS TO PREPARE LOW-INCOME STUDENTS WITH THE SCHOLARSHIP, DISCIPLINE, AND HONOR NECESSARY TO SUCCEED IN COLLEGE AND LEAD EXEMPLARY LIVES, AND TO BE A CATALYST FOR EDUCATION REFORM IN CHICAGO.
IRS990.Desc: THE NOBLE NETWORK OF CHARTER SCHOOLS WAS ESTABLISHED FORTHE PURPOSE OF REPLICATING THE NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED NOBLESTREET CHARTER HIGH SCHOOL, WHICH OPENED IN 1999. THENETWORK PROVIDES A QUALITY EDUCATION TO ENABLE THE LOW-INCOME POPULATION TO MAKE CHANGES TO IMPROVE THEIR LIVES. THE NETWORK SERVED 12,345 STUDENTS IN 2018.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: OPENED IN 2010, NOBLE DAY CARE, L3C (NDC) PROVIDES AN ENRICHING EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE TO THE APPROXIMATELY 60 CHILDREN ENROLLED IN THE PROGRAM. NDC'S EDUCATIONAL MODEL FOLLOWS A BALANCED APPROACH OF FREE EXPLORATION, NATURAL ENVIRONMENT LEARNING WITH GUIDANCE, AND BUILT-IN STRUCTURED ACTIVITIES. QUALIFIED TEACHERS PROVIDE A SET CURRICULUM AND PREPARE ASSESSMENTS TO ENSURE THE CHILDREN ARE MEETING DEVELOPMENTAL GOALS THROUGH THEIR LEARNING. NDC IS ALSO AN APPROVED SITE FOR NOBLE NETWORK OF CHARTER SCHOOLS' STUDENTS WHO CAN EARN VOLUNTEER HOURS FOR PARTICIPATING IN NDC ACTIVITIES AND HELPING OUT AROUND THE FACILITY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION ENGAGED THE SERVICES OF A LEGAL FIRM TO PROVIDE ADVICE RELATING TO PROPOSED STATE LEGISLATION DIRECTLY AFFECTING THE ORGANIZATION AND ITS PROGRAM SERVICE REVENUES.

THE SCHOOL IS A TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION AS DESCRIBED IN SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE (THE CODE) AND IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES ON RELATED INCOME PURSUANT TO SECTION 501(A) OF THE CODE. IN ADDITION, THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE HAS DETERMINED THAT THE SCHOOL IS NOT A PRIVATE FOUNDATION WITHIN THE MEANING OF SECTION 509(A) OF THE CODE. THE SCHOOL HAS ADOPTED THE REQUIREMENTS FOR ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AND MANAGEMENT HAS DETERMINED THAT THE SCHOOL WAS NOT REQUIRED TO RECORD A LIABILITY RELATED TO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AS OF JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017.
NOBLE NETWORK OF CHARTER SCHOOLS FULLY DISCLOSES ITS NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY TO ALL POTENTIAL STUDENTS. COPIES OF THIS POLICY CAN BE OBTAINED UPON REQUEST.
THE SCHOOL RECEIVES PER CAPITA TUITION FROM CHICAGO PUBLIC SCHOOLS AND STATE AND FEDERAL GRANTS THROUGH OTHER GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES.

IRS990ScheduleG.ExplanationIfNoTxt: THE GAMING ACTIVITY DISCLOSED ABOVE REPRESENTS A 50/50 RAFFLE HELD IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE TASTE OF COLLEGE FUNDRAISING EVENT DISCLOSED IN PART II. NO LICENSE IS REQUIRED FOR THIS TYPE OF ACTIVITY IN THE STATE OF ILLINOIS.
IRS990ScheduleG.GamingManagerServicesProvTxt: OVERALL FINANCIAL OVERSIGHT OF ALL ACTIVITIES OF THE ORGANIZATION

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS ELIGIBILITY - IN ORDER TO EARN A SCHOLARSHIP FROM THE NOBLE NETWORK ALUMNI OFFICE, A STUDENT MUST COMPLETE AN APPLICATION. CRITERIA - APPLICANTS MUST HAVE A 2.0 MINIMUM CUMULATIVE GPA. RECIPIENTS WILL BE CHOSEN BASED UPON A DISPLAY OF VALUES FOUND CONSISTENT WITHIN THE ENTIRE NOBLE NETWORK. SCHOLARSHIP - THE STUDENT DEMONSTRATES A COMMITMENT TO HARD WORK AND GETTING EXTRA HELP TO ACHIEVE ACADEMIC GOALS. DISCIPLINE - THE STUDENT SERVES AS AN EXCELLENT ROLE MODEL FOR STUDENTS THROUGH THEIR BEHAVIOR AND SPIRIT. HONOR - THE STUDENT SHOWS CONCERN FOR OTHERS AND IS WILLING TO HELP THE NOBLE NETWORK ACHIEVE ITS MISSION. THE NETWORK ALUMNI COORDINATOR WILL VERIFY ENROLLMENT IN COLLEGE AND ADHERENCE TO THE TRAITS OF SCHOLARSHIP, DISCIPLINE, AND HONOR AS OUTLINED ABOVE. THE AMOUNT OF THE SCHOLARSHIP WILL BE BASED ON NEED AND AVAILABLE FUNDS.

SOME MEMBERS OF SENIOR MANAGEMENT WERE COMPENSATED WITH BONUSES BASED ON METRICS IMPORTANT TO THE FINANCIAL AND OPERATIONAL SUCCESS OF THE ORGANIZATION, INCLUDING CONTRIBUTIONS RAISED, GRANTS FROM FOUNDATIONS, INCREASES IN AVERAGE PER PUPIL FUNDING, AND THE SUCCESSFUL EXECUTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING AGREEMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE K, PART II, LINE 3, COLUMN A - TOTAL PROCEEDS OF ISSUE:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INCLUDES $19,903,820 OF SALES PROCEEDS PLUS $2,741 OF INVESTMENT EARNINGS AND $2,006,401 IN RESERVE FUNDS DERIVED FROM NON-SALE PROCEEDS. PROJECT COMPLETED 2016. ALL FUNDS DRAWN-DOWN AND APPLIED AGAINST CAPITAL EXPENDITURES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE K, PART II, LINE 11, COLUMN B - TOTAL PROCEEDS OF ISSUE:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INCLUDES $21,495,226 OF SALE PROCEEDS PLUS $122,435 OF INVESTMENT EARNINGS AND $1,679,483 IN RESERVE FUNDS DERIVED FROM NON-SALE PROCEEDS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE K, PART II, LINE 11, COLUMN B - OTHER SPENT PROCEEDS:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: $21,062,321 OF 2015 TAX-EXEMPT BOND PROCEEDS PLUS $122,435 OF INVESTMENT EARNINGS USED TO ADVANCE REFUND THE 2006 SERIES AND 2007 SERIES. PRIOR ISSUES OF TAX-EXEMPT BONDS, WITH FINAL REFUNDING IN SEPTEMBER 2017.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE K, PART IV, LINE 2A, COLUMN A - NO REBATE DUE:
SCHEDULE K, PART IV, LINE 2A, COLUMN B - NO REBATE DUE:

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN ADDITION TO THE PUBLICLY TRADED SECURITIES IDENTIFIED ON SCHEDULE M, LINE 9 THAT WERE INCLUDED IN CURRENT YEAR REVENUE, AN ADDITIONAL $5,878,199 IN CONTRIBUTED SECURITIES RECEIVED DURING THE TAX YEAR WERE NOT INCLUDED IN CURRENT YEAR REVENUES. $5,878,199 RELATED TO RECEIPTS OF PRIOR YEAR PLEDGE AMOUNTS PREVIOUSLY BOOKED TO REVENUE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MANAGEMENT ASSISTS IN PREPARING AND THEN REVIEWING A DRAFT OF FORM 990 PREPARED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S CPA FIRM. A FINAL COPY IS PROVIDED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS BEFORE FILING WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THIS POLICY REQUIRES ALL OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, AND KEY EMPLOYEES TO DISCLOSE ANNUALLY INTERESTS THAT COULD GIVE RISE TO CONFLICTS. NOBLE NETWORK OF CHARTER SCHOOLS ENFORCES AND MONITORS ITS COMPLIANCE BY REVIEWING DISCLOSURE STATEMENTS REGULARLY AND REQUIRES ALL PARTIES TO DISCLOSE POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST AS THEY ARISE THROUGHOUT THE YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS DETERMINES THE COMPENSATION FOR THE ORGANIZATION'S CEO AND SUPERINTENDENT. SALARY FOR ALL OTHER EMPLOYEES IS DETERMINED BY MANAGEMENT'S RESEARCH OF COMPARABLE POSITIONS AT COMPARABLE ORGANIZATIONS. THE CEO AND SUPERINTENDENT REVIEW AND APPROVE THE COMPENSATION ACCORDINGLY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION FURNISHES THIS INFORMATION UPON REQUEST.
